title: eCurv to Offer Constellation's Efficiency Made Easy Program
text:
[September 23, 2015] eCurv to Offer Constellation's Efficiency Made Easy Program 
eCurv, Inc. , a leading provider of demand management software services, announced today that it will offer Constellation's Efficiency Made Easy (EME) program to commercial clients. The program provides customers the opportunity to fund the installation of eCurv's QPAC(Queued Power Access) software as part of their Constellation electricity supply agreement. 
Modeled after the digital queuing technology that has enabled the exponential growth in the service capacity of the Mobile Wireless and Information Technology sectors, eCurv's QPACservice automatically queues the access of electric loads, such as HVAC systems, electric pumps, motors, battery charging, heating and refrigeration equipment, thereby avoiding expensive peak demand events. 
"Our customers will save as soon as QPAC is active with no upfront capital costs through Constellation's Efficiency Made Easy program," said Edson Almeida, President and CEO of eCurv. "eCurv's QPACsoftware service delivers up to 35 percent peak demand savings for our customers." 
As part of its Efficiency Made Easy program, Constellation commercial and industrial electricity supply customers are able to implement energy efficiency upgrades and other energy management solutions without up-front capital expenditures. The costs of these solutions are included over the term of a customer's supply agreement. In most cases, customers realize an immediate savings on energy costs from reduced energy use. 
About eCurv 
eCurv, Inc. is a high tech company based in Cambridge, MA, offering a fully scalable software service that effectively manages rapidly increasing energy costs. eCurv's patented QPAC TM (Queued Power Access) software service is available, secure and reliable. QPAC can seamlessly integrate with both open and proprietary building automation systems. For more information, visit www.ecurv.com or follow us on twitter @eCurvInc . 
About Constellation 
Constellation is a leading competitive retail supplier of power, natural gas and energy products and services for homes and businesses across the continental United States. Constellation's family of retail businesses serves more than 2.5 million residential, public sector and business customers, including more than two-thirds of the Fortune 100. Baltimore-based Constellation is a subsidiary of Exelon Corporation (NYSE: EXC), the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with 2014 revenues of approximately $27.4 billion, and more than 32,000 megawatts of owned capacity comprising one of the nation's cleanest and lowest-cost power generation fleets.
